alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:41PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN PHELPS...WESTERN BUFFALO AND EASTERN DAWSON COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eddyville to near Elm Creek to near Loomis. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elm Creek, Sumner, and Miller around 245 PM CDT. Amherst around 300 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Odessa. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 250 and 267. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
